summary: This document is a communication regarding the case U.S. v. Tartaglione, referencing an ex parte order issued by Judge Karas. The order directs disclosure of documents to Government firewall counsel and sets a deadline for a response from Mr. Barket. It also mentions an upcoming hearing will be rescheduled.

persons.name: Judge Karas
persons.context: Issued an ex parte order directing disclosure of documents to Government firewall counsel and set a deadline for Mr. Barket's response.

persons.name: Mr. Barket
persons.context: Given until May 5, 2020, to file any additional response to the court order.

persons.name: Michael
persons.context: Sent the email communication attaching copies of documents and relaying the judge's orders.

connections.description: Judge Karas issued an order providing Mr. Barket a deadline to file a response.

events.title: Ex Parte Order Issued
events.description: Judge Karas issued an ex parte order directing disclosure of documents to Government firewall counsel upon defense counsels' requests.

events.title: Deadline for Response
events.description: Mr. Barket is given until May 5, 2020, to file any additional response to the court order.

keyFacts: The document pertains to the case U.S. v. Tartaglione, indicating a legal proceeding separate from but potentially related to the Epstein case context.
Judge Karas issued an ex parte order for document disclosure to Government firewall counsel, suggesting sensitive or protected materials are involved.
A hearing in the case is mentioned as being rescheduled, indicating ongoing judicial activity.
